elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is meant by communication?
elements.correctAnswer: Communication means exchanging information. Not only sentences and words, but also posture, gestures (expressive movements of the body) and facial expressions are important.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: On which four levels can you communicate?
elements.correctAnswer: Factual level: What the sender is informing about / Self-disclosure level: What the sender is disclosing about themselves (consciously or unconsciously). / Appeal level: What the sender wants the recipient to do. / Relationship level: How the sender relates to the recipient.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Which levels of communication are suitable for a factual conversation?
elements.correctAnswer: The factual level or the self-disclosure level.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Why do misunderstandings arise?
elements.correctAnswer: Misunderstandings arise when the sender and receiver are on different levels of communication. For example, if a sender makes a factual comment, but the receiver understands this as criticism of their own person with the ear of the relationship level.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Why do self-confident people communicate better?
elements.correctAnswer: Self-confident people are less likely to feel attacked by others, do not have to constantly justify themselves and are more likely to receive messages at the factual level or at the self-disclosure level. They have the courage to say exactly what they mean and are less vague or ambiguous.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Can't you communicate?
elements.correctAnswer: No. According to Watzlawick's theory, people cannot do anything without their behavior being interpreted by others. You always say something - if not with words, then with your posture, body movements or facial expressions.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Name three basic rules for constructive criticism.
elements.correctAnswer: Uplifting criticism should always be instructive; you should praise someone when it is appropriate; you must be careful not to hurt anyone.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: To what extent does constructive criticism strengthen?
elements.correctAnswer: Building criticism strengthens self-confidence and therefore also the ability to communicate. In addition, constructive criticism supports personal development.
